title: Watch: Explained: What are Supplementary Demands for Grants?
description: Every Budget is presented in February and lays out the plan for the government’s spending in the financial year that will start in April that year. This relies on a fair bit of estimation. Once about 8-9 months are past, the government is in a much better state to have an accurate idea of how much it is going to spend in the year. So, in December, it submits what is known as a Supplementary Demand for Grants if it needs more money.

Decoding Noam Chomsky's friendship with Jeffrey Epstein
description: This is not a story about crimes. There is no evidence linking Noam Chomsky to Jeffrey Epstein’s sexual offences. That boundary should not be blurred. But this is very much a story about power, judgement, and proximity. About how elite worlds function. About how influence circulates. And about how even those who devote their lives to critiquing systems of domination can misread them when they arrive dressed as conversation.

title: Watch: Julian Assange Challenges Nobel Peace Prize Award to Maria Corina Machado
description: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange has filed a criminal complaint in Sweden against the Nobel Foundation, opposing the Nobel Peace Prize awarded to Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado. He has sought to freeze 11 million Swedish kronor, calling the prize an “instrument of war.”

description: Ishan Kishan’s innings helped Jharkhand post a formidable 262/3, anchored by a 177-run second-wicket partnership with Kumar Kushagra, who contributed a lively 81 off 38 balls. Medium pacer Anukul Roy delivered a crucial all-round performance, taking two early wickets and adding a rapid 40 off 20 balls, while Haryana’s Yashvardhan Dalal top-scored with 53 in a losing cause.

title: 'Dhurandhar' vs 'Avatar Fire And Ash': Ranveer Singh starrer slows down; crosses Rs 460cr
description: Dhurandhar has achieved a record-breaking second week at the box office, surpassing the collections of Pathaan and Gadar 2. The film, starring Ranveer Singh and others, earned ₹253 crore in its second week, bringing its total to ₹463.48 crore. Despite a slow start to its third week, Dhurandhar continues to compete as Avatar Fire And Ash gains momentum.

What is SHANTI Bill 2025? Top things to know about the new nuclear energy bill
description: India's Lok Sabha has passed the SHANTI Bill, ushering in a significant overhaul of its civil nuclear framework. The legislation opens parts of the sector to private participation for the first time, aiming to boost nuclear power capacity and modernize regulations. It also introduces a new safety and liability framework.

title: ‘Case of acute acronym-itis’: Congress takes swipe at PM Modi over MGNREGA replacement
description: Congress criticizes Prime Minister Modi for 'acronym-itis' following the passage of the VB-G RAM G Bill, which replaces the MGNREGA. The opposition protested the removal of Mahatma Gandhi's name and the financial burden on states, staging a dharna after the bill's approval.

‘Apple chose poorly’: Epic Games CEO angry at Apple; App Store rules change in Japan
description: Epic Games CEO Tim Sweeney has slammed Apple's response to Japan's new app store laws, calling it a "travesty of obstruction."  Despite Japan's move to break Apple's commission monopoly, Sweeney claims Apple is imposing "junk fees" and misleading warning screens, preventing Fortnite's return to iOS in Japan. Epic Games plans to file complaints with the Japanese Fair Trade Commission.

title: Security guards smash Mercedes with sticks, batons in Gurgaon
description: Security guards in Gurgaon vandalized a Mercedes outside Cyber Park after the driver allegedly drove on the wrong side of the road. Witnesses reported an argument and alleged assault by the driver before guards retaliated, smashing the car's windshield, taillights, and side mirror. The incident, captured on video, has not yet resulted in a police complaint.

description: Adani Group plans a massive Rs 1 lakh crore investment in its airports business over five years, driven by strong growth projections for India's aviation sector. The company is set to launch commercial operations at Navi Mumbai International Airport, a significant expansion that will ease pressure on existing facilities and bolster the group's position as India's largest airport operator.

title: Five Auto trends in 2026 that will redefine the Indian car market
description: 2026 promises to be a year of consolidation, smarter technologies, and shifting buyer priorities. From affordable electrification to the redefinition of entry-level mobility, the road ahead looks very different from where we started.

description: Indian students studying abroad saw a slight dip in 2025, with 1.2 million enrolled globally. This reflects increased costs and unpredictable visa rules in traditional destinations like Canada, the US, UK, and Australia. Families are now exploring new options, with Germany and France showing significant growth in Indian student numbers.

title: Pune’s Christmas tree market sees warm blend of tradition, modernity and rising demand for sustainability
Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill: New institutional architecture of higher education
description: India’s higher education system has expanded fast, but regulation has stayed cluttered and uneven. This column explains how the Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill, 2025 tries to fix that by creating one apex body and three linked councils for regulation, accreditation, and standards, with outcomes and public transparency at the centre. The promise is graded autonomy with accountability.

title: Adani to invest ₹1 lakh crore in airports; eyes aggressive bids in next privatisation round
description: Navi Mumbai International Airport will become the latest addition to the Adani Group's expanding airport portfolio, further strengthening its presence in India's aviation infrastructure

title: Om Birla meets MPs as Parliament concludes: PM Modi, Priyanka in attendance
description: Parliament's Winter Session concluded Friday with Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha adjourned sine die. Despite disruptions over the VB-G RAM G Bill, both Houses saw significant legislative work, with Lok Sabha achieving 111% productivity. Key bills were passed, and leaders met to mark the session's end, though opposition protests continued.

Ask Dhirendra: 'How do I decide how much to save and invest?'
description: When income feels just enough, saving isn't about a fixed percentage but a conscious decision to prioritize it. Track expenses to identify leaks, and start with even a small, consistent amount. The key is to make savings non-negotiable and ensure it grows with every income increase, fostering a habit of consistent financial growth.

title: UGC issues alert against 3 fake universities, warns students against invalid degrees
description: The University Grants Commission has issued a stern warning against three institutions – NIMS, Delhi; Sarva Bharatiya Shiksha Peeth, Karnataka; and National Backward Krushi Vidyapeeth, Maharashtra – operating as universities without legal recognition. These entities are issuing invalid degrees, which will not be accepted for further studies or employment. Students are urged to verify institutional recognition before admission.

description: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez are nearing completion of their lavish Beverly Hills mansion.  Acquired for $165 million, the estate boasts a unique UFO-shaped structure serving as a sauna.  The property also features a large swimming pool, sports courts, and a historic Georgian architectural style.  This mega-mansion reflects the couple's passion for adventure and technology.

However, this spike masks underlying volatility and a growing import dependence on China. The trade deficit with China is widening, raising concerns about India's export strategy and reliance on Chinese goods.

The unprovoked assault, captured on CCTV, left the child with injuries. Police have registered a case under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, with the accused reportedly undergoing psychiatric treatment.

title: US immigration crackdown: Trump suspends green card lottery; what led to the step?

Valente, a Portuguese national, is suspected of multiple killings before dying by suicide.

description: Bangladesh slid back into turmoil after the killing of Sharif Osman Hadi, a prominent youth leader of last year’s July Uprising, triggered violent protests. The 32-year-old was shot by masked gunmen in central Dhaka while launching his election campaign and later died in hospital. His death has reignited political instability ahead of crucial national elections, with protests, arson and competing narratives deepening uncertainty at a critical moment for the country and its relations with New Delhi.

The 32-year-old, who leads the NFL with 14 receiving touchdowns, is being treated cautiously.  While his return is week-to-week, the team hopes for a playoff comeback, with an 11-day recovery window ahead.

Toronto management must navigate this delicate situation. The coming months will be crucial for both Matthews and the Maple Leafs' legacy. The team aims for immediate success.

title: SC upholds man's will cutting off daughter for marrying 'outsider'
Live-in relationships not illegal, says Allahabad HC; grants police protection to 12 couples
description: The Allahabad High Court ruled that live-in relationships are not illegal, granting protection to 12 couples facing threats. Justice Vivek Kumar Singh emphasized that adults in such relationships are entitled to life and liberty, directing police to provide immediate security after verifying age and voluntary cohabitation.

title: Meta AI’s highest-paid employee unhappy; calls management 'suffocating'
description: Meta's $14.8 billion investment in Scale AI and the integration of its CEO, Alexandr Wang, into a new "superintelligence" lab are reportedly facing internal friction. Wang allegedly finds Mark Zuckerberg's micromanagement "suffocating," while some staff question Wang's experience. This shift also clashes with Meta's open-source AI philosophy, leading to executive departures.

title: Southall gurdwara property raided by UK police and immigration
Luxury to lock-up: Luthra brothers sleep on floor, eat dal-rice
description: Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, owners of Birch by Romeo Lane, spent their first night in a police lock-up after being arrested in connection with a fatal fire. They were interrogated extensively, and their request for mattresses was denied after medical examinations declared them fit. Other partners and managers have also been arrested and remanded in judicial custody.

title: 'I was humiliated, slapped for not paying rent': Tenant strangles landlady in Delhi
description: Police arrested a tenant, Himanshu Yadav, for allegedly robbing and murdering his 65-year-old landlady in Rohini. Driven by anger over rent arrears and humiliation, Yadav strangled Naresh Kumari and stole her jewelry. He then fled across several states, mortgaging the stolen items before being apprehended in Delhi.

title: Paul Heyman and Marla Heyman combined net worth in 2025: WWE contracts, ECW legacy
description: Wrestling icon Paul Heyman's 2025 net worth is estimated at $10 million, primarily from his WWE career, reportedly earning around $2 million annually.  While his financial success is well-documented, details about his ex-wife Marla Heyman's finances remain private, making any combined net worth calculation speculative.  His ECW past, marked by bankruptcy, contrasts with his current WWE earnings.

title: Braun Strowman & Raquel Rodriguez net worth 2025: WWE earnings, lifestyle & more
description: Braun Strowman and Raquel Rodriguez showcase contrasting WWE financial journeys in 2025. Strowman, a former headliner, boasts an estimated net worth of $2-5 million, built on lucrative deals and merchandise. Rodriguez, a rising star, has a projected $700,000, with her value steadily increasing through television exposure and championship opportunities.

title: 'Gemini 3 can do things that Copilot can’t': Microsoft AI chief Suleyman
description: Microsoft's AI chief, Mustafa Suleyman, acknowledged Google's Gemini 3's capabilities while highlighting Copilot's unique strengths, particularly in real-time visual interaction. He emphasized Microsoft's commitment to developing AI that serves human interests, drawing a firm line against autonomous systems that could become uncontrollable. This stance follows a revised OpenAI agreement.
